trans-unit.source: Machine learning web services examples built with R | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Machine learning web services examples built with R | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Find a useful set of web services examples created with R code and Machine Learning, and published to the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: Find a useful set of web services examples created with R code and Machine Learning, and published to the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: In this article are example web services were created using Azure Machine Learning and published to the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In this article are example web services were created using Azure Machine Learning and published to the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Each web service example has a comprehensive document attached, embedding sample data sets for testing the services and explaining how the user can create a similar service themselves.
trans-unit.target: Each web service example has a comprehensive document attached, embedding sample data sets for testing the services and explaining how the user can create a similar service themselves.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Machine Learning Studio, users can write R code and with a few clicks, publish it as a web service for applications and devices to consume around the world.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Machine Learning Studio, users can write R code and with a few clicks, publish it as a web service for applications and devices to consume around the world.

trans-unit.source: From producing simple calculators that provide statistical functionality to creating a custom text-mining sentiment analysis predictor, both new and experienced R users can benefit from the ease with which users of Azure Machine Learning can operationalize R code.
trans-unit.target: From producing simple calculators that provide statistical functionality to creating a custom text-mining sentiment analysis predictor, both new and experienced R users can benefit from the ease with which users of Azure Machine Learning can operationalize R code.

trans-unit.source: While these web services could be consumed by users, potentially through a mobile app or a website, the purpose of these web services examples is to show how Machine Learning can operationalize R scripts for analytical purposes and be used to create web services on top of R code.
trans-unit.target: While these web services could be consumed by users, potentially through a mobile app or a website, the purpose of these web services examples is to show how Machine Learning can operationalize R scripts for analytical purposes and be used to create web services on top of R code.

trans-unit.source: Each example includes a C# example for web service consumption.
trans-unit.target: Each example includes a C# example for web service consumption.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram of R code in Azure Machine Learning: R solutions for proprietary use or published to the Azure Marketplace.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram of R code in Azure Machine Learning: R solutions for proprietary use or published to the Azure Marketplace.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Consider the following scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Consider the following scenarios.

trans-unit.source: A user works with a generic model that can be applied to a new user’s data, such as a basic forecasting of time series data or a custom-built R method with advanced analytics.
trans-unit.target: A user works with a generic model that can be applied to a new user’s data, such as a basic forecasting of time series data or a custom-built R method with advanced analytics.

trans-unit.source: This user publishes the model as a web service for others to consume with their data.
trans-unit.target: This user publishes the model as a web service for others to consume with their data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Binary Classifier</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Binary Classifier</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster Model</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster Model</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Multivariate Linear Regression</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Multivariate Linear Regression</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Forecasting - Exponential Smoothing</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Forecasting - Exponential Smoothing</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ETS + STL Forecasting</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ETS + STL Forecasting</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Forecasting - Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Forecasting - Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average (ARIMA)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Survival Analysis</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Survival Analysis</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: A user has data that provides useful predictions through R code, such as a large sample of personality questionnaires clustered through a k-means algorithm to predict the user’s personality type, or health survey data that can be used to predict an individual’s risk for lung cancer with a survival analysis R package.
trans-unit.target: A user has data that provides useful predictions through R code, such as a large sample of personality questionnaires clustered through a k-means algorithm to predict the user’s personality type, or health survey data that can be used to predict an individual’s risk for lung cancer with a survival analysis R package.

trans-unit.source: The user publishes the data through a web service that predicts a new user’s outcome.
trans-unit.target: The user publishes the data through a web service that predicts a new user’s outcome.

trans-unit.source: A user has generic data (such as a text corpus) that allows a web service to be built and applied generically across different types of use cases and scenarios.
trans-unit.target: A user has generic data (such as a text corpus) that allows a web service to be built and applied generically across different types of use cases and scenarios.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Lexicon Based Sentiment Analysis</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Lexicon Based Sentiment Analysis</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: A user provides advanced calculations or simulations that don’t require any trained model or fitting of a model to the user’s data.
trans-unit.target: A user provides advanced calculations or simulations that don’t require any trained model or fitting of a model to the user’s data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Difference in Proportions Test</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Difference in Proportions Test</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Normal Distribution Suite</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Normal Distribution Suite</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Binomial Distribution Suite</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Binomial Distribution Suite</linkText><title></title>
